page.title: 08THE NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: The most common mistake people make about the National Trust is they think it is run or owned by the government. But this is not true.Since the end of the Second World War 2,400,000 acres of the countryside have disappeared under concrete.During that time the Trust has acquired 344,000 acres which it now protects.Before the National Trust accepts a property there must be money left with the estate.This is to pay for repairs ,if neccessary.When the National Trust accepted Dunham Hall it was very neglected.The late Lord Stamford had lived in a small part of the house and although most of the rest of the house was packed up and locked away,the contents and rooms remained untouched for several decades.The N.T. is today the largest conservation group in Britain and the country's largest private landowner.
